{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Refimprove|date=July 2013}} {{Year nav topic5|2013|Philippine television}} The following is a list of events affecting '''Philippine television in 2013'''. Events listed include television show debuts, finales, cancellations, birthdays, anniversaries, and channel launches, closures and rebrandings, as well as information about controversies and carriage disputes. ==Events== ===March=== *March 21: [[Kris Aquino]] appeared in a 30-minute interview with [[TV Patrol]] to announce her resignation from all her [[ABS-CBN]] shows to spend time with her youngest son.{{cite web|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/entertainment/03/21/13/kris-aquino-resigns-all-her-shows |title=Kris Aquino resigns from all her shows |publisher=ABS-CBN News |date= |accessdate=2014-02-25}} She also revealed that [[James Yap]] made sexual advances on her inside her room, which she refused. She said Yap threatened her in the presence of Bimby, who was traumatized of the said incident.[https://web.archive.org/web/20130321140036/http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/video/entertainment/03/21/13/kris-breaks-silence-james-accusations Kris breaks silence James accusations, ABS-CBN News]{{cite web|url=http://entertainment.inquirer.net/86431/kris-aquino-quits-showbiz |title=Kris Aquino quits showbiz | Inquirer Entertainment |publisher=Entertainment.inquirer.net |date=March 21, 2013 |accessdate=2014-02-25}} Aquino also filed a temporary protection order on March 20, 2013. In the petition, Kris asked the court to order Yap to stay away from her, her 5-year-old son Bimby and any household member, keep a distance of at least 100 meters, and to stay away from her residence, school, place of employment or any place frequented by her and her son.{{cite web|url=http://entertainment.inquirer.net/86163/kris-aquino-files-protection-order-vs-ex-hubby-james-yapz |title=Kris Aquino files protection order vs ex-hubby James Yap | Inquirer Entertainment |publisher=Entertainment.inquirer.net |date=March 20, 2013 |accessdate=2014-02-25}} ===April=== *April 11: [[TV5 (Philippines)|TV5]]'s parent company [[MediaQuest Holdings]] has announced that it will not renew its blocktime agreement with the government network [[Intercontinental Broadcasting Corporation]] under the [[AKTV]] primetime sports block, when AKTV ceased airing on May 31. *April 14: [[Ariella Arida]], [[Bea Rose Santiago]], Joanna Cindy Miranda, [[Mutya Johanna Datul]] and Pia Wurtzbach were crowned as the new [[Binibining Pilipinas 2013|Binibining Pilipinas]] winners. Arida was crowned by [[Miss Universe 2012]] 1st runner-up [[Janine Tugonon]] as the new Miss Universe–Philippines 2013. Santiago was crowned as the new Binibining Pilipinas–International 2013 by the outgoing titleholder [[Nicole Schmitz]]. Miranda as the new Binibining Pilipinas–Tourism 2013 crowned by [[Katrina Jayne Dimaranan]]. Datul was crowned as the new Binibining Pilipinas–Supranational 2013 by Miss Supranational 2012 3rd runner-up Elaine Kay Moll. Wurtzbach ended as the Binibining Pilipinas 2013 1st runner-up.{{cite web |first=Michael Josh |last=Villanueva |url= http://www.rappler.com/life-and-style/specials/bb-pilipinas/news/26248-binibining-pilipinas-2013-winners-crowned |title=Binibining Pilipinas 2013 winners crowned |work=rappler.com |date=April 15, 2013 |accessdate=July 11, 2014}} ===May=== *May 31: After two years of broadcast, [[AKTV]] on [[Intercontinental Broadcasting Corporation|IBC]] ceased operations on Friday evening. ===June=== *June 8: 13-year-old singer Roel Manlangit wins [[Pilipinas Got Talent (season 4)|the fourth season]] of ''[[Pilipinas Got Talent]]''. *June 9: [[Goin' Bulilit]] introduces the nine new cast members such as JB Agustin, [[Lance Lucido]], CX Navarro, Aldred Nasayao, Jillian Aguila, Aaliyah Belmoro, Allyson McBride, Ashley Sarmiento and Kazumi Porquez. *June 10: The controversial drama [[My Husband's Lover]] began airing on [[GMA Network]] which tackles homosexual relationships between men. ===August=== *August 3: Video snippets of [[Chito Miranda]] having sexual intercourse with [[Neri Naig]], and 2 two other women in three different occasions appeared in YouTube.{{cite web | url = http://entertainment.inquirer.net/106301/internet-abuzz-over-sex-tape-of-chito-miranda-neri-naig | title = Chito Miranda, girlfriend in deep sex scandal | publisher = INQUIRER.net | work = Latest Entertainment News | accessdate = 2013-08-04 | date = August 3, 2013}} The video snippets with the other two women were taken down the same day, but the one with Naig became a viral hit that was shared in different [[blogs]] and social media sites. On his Twitter account, Miranda said his room was recently robbed. Among those stolen was his hard disk drive, where photo and video files were stored.{{cite web | url = http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/entertainment/08/03/13/chito-miranda-cries-foul-over-sex-scandal | work = Entertainment | title = Chito Miranda cries foul over 'sex scandal' | publisher = ABS-CBNNews.com | date = August 3, 2013 | accessdate = 2013-08-04}}[https://twitter.com/chitomirandajr/status/363532660842307584 Twitter / chitomirandajr: Thanks for all your prayers] On Parokya ni Edgar's Facebook page and on Miranda's Instagram page,[http://instagram.com/p/ciLFWevAuN/ Instagram] Miranda expressed his sadness on the leaking of the private video. He also asked for forgiveness from both his and Naig's families. {{cite web | url = http://www.philstar.com/entertainment/2013/08/03/1050831/chito-miranda-apologizes-family-sex-video | title = Chito Miranda apologizes to family for 'sex video' | publisher = philstar.com | work = Entertainment | author = Smith, Chuck | date = August 3, 2013 | accessdate = 2013-08-04}} A second more graphic clip, which is 11 minutes and 20 seconds long,different from the first video that spread in August was uploaded Monday afternoon on a Facebook page.{{cite web | url = http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/entertainment/09/30/13/another-chito-neri-sex-scandal-video-surfaces | title = Another Chito-Neri sex scandal video surfaces | work = Entertainment | publisher = ABS-CBN.com | date = March 30, 2013 | accessdate = 2013-10-01}}{{cite web | url = http://technology.inquirer.net/29933/cyberspace-abuzz-again-with-new-chito-miranda-naig-sex-video | title = Cyberspace abuzz again with new ‘Chito Miranda, Naig’ sex video | author = de Jesus, Jullianne Love | publisher = Inquirer.net | date = October 1, 2013 | accessdate = 2013-10-01}} *August 18: Former actress [[Megan Young]] crowned as [[Miss World Philippines 2013]] at the [[Solaire Resort & Casino]] in [[Parañaque City]]{{cite web|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/lifestyle/08/18/13/megan-young-miss-world-ph-2013|title=Megan Young is Miss World PH 2013|work=abs-cbnnews.com |date= |accessdate=2013-08-19}} ===September=== *September 2: An alleged sex scandal of [[Wally Bayola]] and EB Babes dancer, Yosh Rivera, went viral in social media sites. The video, in which both of them are seen engaging in sexual intercourse, was uploaded onto YouTube that night. The video was immediately removed from the site but it was already circulated to other sites such as Facebook. After the scandal became known, the two of them have not appeared on ''Eat Bulaga!'' since.{{cite web|url=http://www.sunstar.com.ph/manila/entertainment/2013/09/03/sex-video-comedian-wally-bayola-eb-babe-yosh-rivera-goes-viral-30121 |title=Alleged sex video of comedian Wally Bayola, EB babe Yosh Rivera goes viral |publisher=Sun.Star |date= |accessdate=2013-09-03}} It was reported that Bayola will temporarily not be appearing on ''[[Eat Bulaga!]]'', as stated by his manager, Malou Choa Fagar who said the comedian "will lie low from the program".{{cite web|last=Smith |first=Chuck |url=http://www.philstar.com/entertainment/2013/09/04/1171111/report-wally-bayola-lie-low-eat-bulaga |title=Report: Wally Bayola to lie low from ‘Eat Bulaga’ | Entertainment, News, The Philippine Star |publisher=philstar.com |date= |accessdate=2013-09-04}} *September 7: [[Mutya Johanna Datul]] was crowned Miss Supranational 2013 and is the first [[Asian people|Asian]] and first Filipina to win the title.{{cite news|url=http://lifestyle.inquirer.net/124155/philippine-bet-wins-ms-supranational-2013|title=Philippine bet wins Ms Supranational 2013|last=de Jesus|first=Julliane Love|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|accessdate=September 8, 2013}} *September 14: [[TV5 (Philippines)|TV5]] marks the launching of the new programming blocks Weekend Do It Better and Everyday All The Way. *September 28: Miss Philippines [[Megan Young]] was crowned [[Miss World 2013]] and is the first Filipina to win the title.{{cite web|title=Miss Philippines Megan Young crowned as Miss World 2013|url=http://news.biharprabha.com/2013/09/miss-philippines-megan-young-crowned-as-miss-world-2013/|accessdate=September 28, 2013}} *September 29: **A fire hits the basement of [[GMA Network Center]] in Quezon City, the headquarters of [[GMA Network]], one of the country's largest TV network. Although there were no injuries, it caused technological difficulties to the transmissions of both [[GMA Network|GMA]] and [[GMA News TV]]. **[[Mitoy Yonting]] wins [[The Voice of the Philippines (season 1)|the first season]] of ''[[The Voice of the Philippines]]''. ===October=== *October 5–6: ABS-CBN marks its 60th Anniversary of the Philippine Television with the Grand Kapamilya Weekend held at the Quezon City Memorial Circle, [[Smart Araneta Coliseum]] and Marikina Sports Complex. *October 20: Eduardo Gaeilo Pajinag, Jr. wins the top prize of 2 Million pesos of [[Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? (Philippine game show)|Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?]].http://www.interaksyon.com/entertainment/it-auditor-wins-p2m-jackpot-in-who-wants-to-be-a-millionaire/ ===November=== *November 9: Miss Philippines [[Ariella Arida]] won third runner-up in the [[Miss Universe 2013]] in [[Moscow Oblast]], Russia.{{cite web |url= http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/lifestyle/11/09/13/ariella-arida-miss-universe-3rd-runner |title=Ariella Arida is Miss Universe 3rd runner-up |first=Miguel |last=Dumaual |work=ABS-CBN News |date=November 10, 2013 |accessdate=July 11, 2014}} *November 30: [[ETC (Philippine TV network)|ETC]] returned to [[DWCP-TV|SBN-21]] after 2 years broadcast on [[DZKB-TV|RPN-9]]. ===December=== *December 1: [[Solar News Channel]] transferred to RPN. *December 17: Miss Philippines [[Bea Rose Santiago]] won [[Miss International 2013]] held in Tokyo, Japan.{{cite web |url= http://www.philstar.com/entertainment/2013/12/18/1269412/miss-philippines-bea-rose-santiago-miss-international-2013 |title=Miss Philippines Bea Rose Santiago is Miss International 2013 |first=Chuck |last=Smith |work=Philippine Star |date=December 18, 2013 |accessdate=July 11, 2014}} *December 23: The network began broadcasting from its new headquarters, the 6,000-sqm [[TV5 Media Center]] located in Reliance, [[Mandaluyong]].{{cite web|url=http://www.newmedia.com.ph/tv5-media-center-groundbreaking-coverage/|title=TV5 Media Center Groundbreaking Coverage|publisher=New Media Philippines|accessdate=August 8, 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://n5e.interaksyon.com/top/4EA1A901A12646E/1001/bagong-tahanan-ng-tv5-sa-mandaluyong-silipin |title=Bagong Tahanan ng TV5 sa Mandaluyong, Silipin |publisher=News5 Everywhere |accessdate=December 21, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131224111513/http://n5e.interaksyon.com/top/4EA1A901A12646E/1001/bagong-tahanan-ng-tv5-sa-mandaluyong-silipin |archivedate=December 24, 2013 }} ==Winners== {{Orphan|date=January 2018}} {{Infobox company | name = 3D Repo Ltd | logo = 3D Repo Logo.svg | caption= Logo of 3D Repo Ltd | type = Privately held company | industry = Software | founded = April 28, 2014 | hq_location_country = London, United Kingdom | key_people = John Davis
(Chairman)
Dr Jozef Doboš
(CEO) | website = http://3drepo.org }} '''3D Repo Ltd''' is a [[Software as a service|Software as a Service (SaaS)]] platform provider of [[Building information modeling|Building Information Modeling (BIM)]] solutions. The company was founded in 2014 by Jozef Doboš as a spin-off from his [[Engineering Doctorate]] in Virtual Environments, Imaging and Visualisation at [[University College London]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.growthbusiness.co.uk/tech-innovators-2015-3d-repo-limited-2490931/|title=Tech Innovators 2015: 3D Repo Limited|date=2015-08-07|work=Growth Business|access-date=2017-10-31|language=en-GB}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.mongodb.com/blog/post/3d-repo-runs-mongodb|title=3D Repo runs in MongoDB {{!}} MongoDB Blog|work=MongoDB|access-date=2017-10-31|language=en-us}} The research titled ''Management and Visualisation of Non-linear History of Polygonal 3D Models''{{Cite news|url=http://3drepo.org/projects/management-and-visualisation-of-non-linear-history-of-polygonal-3d-models/|title=Management and Visualisation of Non-linear History of Polygonal 3D Models|work=3D Repo - Collaborative online BIM platform|access-date=2017-10-31|language=en-US}} was supervised by Prof Anthony Steed and Prof Niloy Mitra, and funded by [[Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council|EPSRC]] and Arup Foresight.{{Cite web|url=http://veiv.cs.ucl.ac.uk/people/73-people/students/290-jozef-dobos|title=Jozef Dobos|last=Pigott|first=Simon|website=veiv.cs.ucl.ac.uk|language=en-gb|access-date=2017-10-31}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.newcivilengineer.com/future-tech/open-source-bim-platform-to-be-piloted-at-canary-wharf/8685909.article|title=Open source BIM platform to be piloted at Canary Wharf|work=New Civil Engineer|access-date=2017-11-01|language=en}} Over the years, 3D Repo won a large number of awards{{Cite web|url=http://www.constructionmanagermagazine.com/ciob-community/winners-ci7ob-innovati8on-awar2ds-unveiled/|title=Construction Manager - Home|website=www.constructionmanagermagazine.com|language=en|access-date=2017-11-01}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.mongodb.com/blog/post/mongodb-innovation-award-winners|title=MongoDB Innovation Award Winners|work=MongoDB|access-date=2017-10-31|language=en-us}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.cs.ucl.ac.uk/archive/article/engd_student_wins_bright_ideas_award/|title=EngD Student wins Bright Ideas Award|website=www.cs.ucl.ac.uk|language=en|access-date=2017-11-01}} and was involved in many high-profile public as well as private construction projects including [[London Olympic Stadium]],{{Cite web|url=http://www.ucl.ac.uk/2034/review/london-global-university/3d-modelling-olympic-stadium|title=3D modelling for the construction industry|website=www.ucl.ac.uk|language=en|access-date=2017-10-31}} [[Wood Wharf]],{{Cite web|url=http://aecmag.com/technology-mainmenu-35/1242-3d-repo-bim-collaboration-in-a-browser|title=3D Repo - BIM collaboration in a browser|last=Admin|website=aecmag.com|language=en-gb|access-date=2017-10-31}} [[Crossrail]]{{Cite news|url=https://www.i3p.org.uk/2017/01/26/crossrail-trials-digital-asset-management-3d-repo/|title=Crossrail trials Digital Asset management with 3D Repo - I3P|date=2017-01-26|work=I3P|access-date=2017-10-31|language=en-GB}} and [[Smart motorway|Smart Motorways]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.constructionenquirer.com/2017/02/13/balfour-and-vinci-trial-virtual-reality-safety-training/|title=Balfour trials virtual reality safety training {{!}} Construction Enquirer|website=www.constructionenquirer.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-10-31}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.geoconnexion.com/publications/geo-uk/issue/may-june-2017-uk-issue/article/3d-repo-new-kid-on-the-block|title=3D Repo: New kid on the block {{!}} GeoConnexion|website=www.geoconnexion.com|language=en|access-date=2017-11-01}} 3D Repo also provides [[Research and development|R&D]] and [[Virtual reality|VR]] capability to large construction companies such as [[Balfour Beatty]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.balfourbeatty.com/how-we-work/sustainability/sustainability-dashboard/expert/|title=Expert|website=Balfour Beatty plc|language=en-gb|access-date=2017-11-01}} and [[Skanska]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.skanska.co.uk/about-skanska/media/press-releases/202132/Skanska-UK-wins-funding-for-a-trial-to-visualise-big-data-|title=Skanska UK wins funding for a trial to visualise big data {{!}} www.skanska.co.uk|website=www.skanska.co.uk|language=en-GB|access-date=2017-11-01}} The lead investor behind the company is an early stage venture capital fund Sussex Place Ventures owned by [[London Business School]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.buildingconstructiondesign.co.uk/news/3d-repo-virtual-reality-project-shortlisted-for-british-construction-industry-award/|title=3d repo virtual reality project shortlisted for british construction industry award {{!}} netMAGmedia Ltd|website=www.buildingconstructiondesign.co.uk|language=en-GB|access-date=2017-10-31}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.spventures.com/company/3d-repo/|title=3D Repo {{!}} Sussex Place Ventures|work=Sussex Place Ventures|access-date=2017-10-31|language=en-GB}} 3D Repo is an organizational member of [[British Computer Society]], the Chartered Institute for IT.{{Cite news|url=http://3drepo.org/3d-repo-becomes-member-of-british-computer-society/|title=3D Repo becomes member of British Computer Society|work=3D Repo - Collaborative online BIM platform|access-date=2017-10-31|language=en-US}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.bcs.org/content/conEvent/9740|title=3D Repo - Non-linear Version Control using NoSQL MongoDB followed by AGM {{!}} Events List {{!}} Events calendar {{!}} Events {{!}} BCS - The Chartered Institute for IT|website=www.bcs.org|language=en|access-date=2017-11-01}} In 2015, 3D Repo was named one of top 20 tech innovators in the UK. == History == === Academic research === 3D Repo version control system—still in its early stages of doctoral research—was originally demonstrated at the joint [[SIGGRAPH]] and Web3D conference in [[Los Angeles]], [[United States]] in August 2012 featuring the [[London King's Cross railway station#Restoration|King's Cross Station Redevelopment]] project by [[Arup Group|Arup]].{{Cite journal|last=Doboš|first=Jozef|last2=Steed|first2=Anthony|date=2012|title=3D Revision Control Framework|url=http://doi.acm.org/10.1145/2338714.2338736|journal=Proceedings of the 17th International Conference on 3D Web Technology|series=Web3D '12|location=New York, NY, USA|publisher=ACM|pages=121–129|doi=10.1145/2338714.2338736|isbn=9781450314329}}{{Cite journal|last=Doboš|first=Jozef|last2=Steed|first2=Anthony|date=2012|title=3D Diff: An Interactive Approach to Mesh Differencing and Conflict Resolution|url=http://doi.acm.org/10.1145/2343045.2343064|journal=ACM SIGGRAPH 2012 Talks|series=SIGGRAPH '12|location=New York, NY, USA|publisher=ACM|pages=15:1–15:1|doi=10.1145/2343045.2343064|isbn=9781450316835}} Later that year, 3D Repo attended an invited lecture at [[German Research Centre for Artificial Intelligence]] (DFKI) in [[Saarbrücken]], [[Germany]] which led to a collaboration and development of the first [[Representational state transfer|REST]] [[Application programming interface|API]] for the system.{{Cite web|url=http://domino.mpi-inf.mpg.de/internet/events.nsf/0/7941CF10F149CE95C1257A8D00513219|title=Campus Event Calendar: Jozef Dobos (10/08/2012 in D 3 2/VizCenter, DFKI)|website=domino.mpi-inf.mpg.de|language=en|access-date=2017-10-31}}{{Cite journal|last=Doboš|first=Jozef|last2=Sons|first2=Kristian|last3=Rubinstein|first3=Dmitri|last4=Slusallek|first4=Philipp|last5=Steed|first5=Anthony|date=2013|title=XML3DRepo: A REST API for Version Controlled 3D Assets on the Web|url=http://doi.acm.org/10.1145/2466533.2466537|journal=Proceedings of the 18th International Conference on 3D Web Technology|series=Web3D '13|location=New York, NY, USA|publisher=ACM|pages=47–55|doi=10.1145/2466533.2466537|isbn=9781450321334}} The front-end visualization was programmed in XML3D and was featured at Web3D 2013 in [[San Sebastián]], [[Spain]]. The main scientific advancement was the introduction of externalized web 3D resources in various encodings that enabled interactivity and prevented web browsers from becoming unresponsive while loading very large 3D models over the [[Internet]].{{Citation|last=3drepoorg|title=XML3DRepo: A REST API for Version Controlled 3D Assets on the Web|date=2013-06-17|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-1BTzVgxI5I&feature=youtu.be|accessdate=2017-10-31}} [[SIGGRAPH#SIGGRAPH Asia|SIGGRAPH Asia]] 2012 in [[Singapore]] also introduced a native Android application and the very first 3D differencing tool ''Interactive 3D Diff''.{{Cite news|url=https://www.3ders.org/articles/20121105-3d-repo-open-source-revision-control-framework-for-large-3d-models.html|title=3D Repo: open source Revision Control Framework for large 3D models|work=3ders.org|access-date=2017-11-01|language=en-US}}{{Cite journal|last=Doboš|first=Jozef|last2=Simondetti|first2=Alvise|last3=Steed|first3=Anthony|date=2012|title=Visualizing 3D Models in Aid of Public Consultation|url=http://doi.acm.org/10.1145/2407696.2407705|journal=SIGGRAPH Asia 2012 Symposium on Apps|series=SA '12|location=New York, NY, USA|publisher=ACM|pages=9:1–9:1|doi=10.1145/2407696.2407705|isbn=9781450319164}}{{Cite journal|last=Doboš|first=Jozef|last2=Steed|first2=Anthony|date=2012|title=3D Diff: An Interactive Approach to Mesh Differencing and Conflict Resolution|url=http://doi.acm.org/10.1145/2407746.2407766|journal=SIGGRAPH Asia 2012 Technical Briefs|series=SA '12|location=New York, NY, USA|publisher=ACM|pages=20:1–20:4|doi=10.1145/2407746.2407766|isbn=9781450319157}} Subsequent collaboration with Prof Niloy Mitra at [[University College London]] led to the development of a reverse engineering system ''3D Timeline'' presented at [[Eurographics]] 2014 in [[Strasbourg]], [[France]].{{Cite journal|last=Doboš|first=Jozef|last2=Mitra|first2=Niloy J.|last3=Steed|first3=Anthony|date=2014-05-01|title=3D Timeline: Reverse engineering of a part-based provenance from consecutive 3D models|url=http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/cgf.12311/abstract|journal=Computer Graphics Forum|language=en|volume=33|issue=2|pages=135–144|doi=10.1111/cgf.12311|issn=1467-8659}} Unlike Interactive 3D Diff which required prior correspondence information, i.e. matching object-level identifiers between revisions, 3D Timeline reverse engineered the relationships and changes between 3D components over multiple revisions without prior correspondence.{{Citation|last=3drepoorg|title=3D Timeline: Reverse Engineering of a Part-based Provenance from Consecutive 3D Models (EG 2014)|date=2014-01-23|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oTmnm1sLf14&feature=youtu.be|accessdate=2017-10-31}} === Commercial development === Based on the potential commercial impact of 3D Repo, the project was awarded VEIV Advance Scholarship{{Cite web|url=http://veiv.cs.ucl.ac.uk/materials-for-students-and-supervisors/forms-guides/201-veiv-advance-scholarship|title=UCL Centre VEIV Advance Scholarship|last=Steed|first=Anthony|website=veiv.cs.ucl.ac.uk|language=en-gb|access-date=2017-10-31}} in order to devise a business plan. This was nominated for the [[Royal Academy of Engineering]] ERA Foundation Entrepreneurs Award in December 2013.{{Cite web|url=http://www.cs.ucl.ac.uk/news/?tx_ttnews%5Btt_news%5D=1048&cHash=69bc396986c489590f153cc5e636b5ab|title=CS EngD VEIV Student shortlisted for Entrepreneurs Award|website=www.cs.ucl.ac.uk|language=en|access-date=2017-10-31}} A commercial company was registered in April 2014{{Cite web|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/09014101|title=3D REPO LTD - Overview (free company information from Companies House)|website=beta.companieshouse.gov.uk|language=en|access-date=2017-10-31}} following the award of an [[Innovate UK]] Smart grant which also helped to secure initial angel funding.{{Cite web|url=https://innovateuk.blog.gov.uk/2016/02/18/meet-our-customers-3d-repo/|title=Meet our customers - 3D Repo - Innovate UK|website=innovateuk.blog.gov.uk|language=en|access-date=2017-10-31}} In the second half of 2014, the project was seconded to [[Balfour Beatty]] via the Breakthrough Information Technology Exchange programme applying the new technology to the [[London Olympic Stadium]] Transformation project.{{Cite news|url=http://www.biteimpact.org/bite-goes-olympic-stadium/|title=BITE goes to the Olympic Stadium - Welcome to BITE - Breakthrough Information Technology Exchange|date=2015-09-09|work=Welcome to BITE - Breakthrough Information Technology Exchange|access-date=2017-11-01|language=en-US}} This led to the development and application of [[Virtual reality]] for [[health and safety]]{{Cite news|url=https://www.wearecallidus.com/opinion/virtual-reality-health-safety-training/|title=Virtual reality ready to redefine health & safety in construction industry|date=2017-02-22|work=Callidus Health & Safety|access-date=2017-11-01|language=en-GB}} training on the M5 [[Smart motorway|Smart Motorway]] in the UK which was nominated for [[British Construction Industry Awards]] in 2017. In 2015, 3D Repo was also invited to join the third cohort of Cognicity Challenge by [[Canary Wharf Group]].{{Cite news|url=http://group.canarywharf.com/media/press-releases/cognicity-challenge-tailors-third-group-of-smart-city-tech-accelerator-to-new-phase-at-canary-wharf-200415/|title=Cognicity Challenge tailors third group of smart city tech accelerator to new phase at Canary Wharf - 20.04.15 - Canary Wharf Group|work=Canary Wharf Group|access-date=2017-10-31|language=en-US}} The challenge consisted of an intensive twelve-week incubation programme designed to identify and solve construction problems faced by Canary Wharf in collaboration with [[Intel]]. The resulting [[Building information modeling|Building Information Modeling]] platform 3drepo.io won the ''Virtual Design and Construction'' category, a £50,000 cash prize and a paid pilot deploying the solution to the [[Wood Wharf]] development.{{Cite news|url=http://group.canarywharf.com/media/press-releases/canary-wharf-group-lays-the-foundations-for-smarter-city-080715/|title=Canary Wharf Group Lays the Foundations for a Smarter City - 08.07.15 - Canary Wharf Group|work=Canary Wharf Group|access-date=2017-10-31|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.eitdigital.eu/newsroom/news/article/3d-repo-wins-the-cognicity-challenge-by-canary-wharf-group/|title=3D Repo wins the Cognicity challenge by Canary Wharf Group|access-date=2017-10-31|language=en}} This enabled design coordination and federation of large 3D models via modern [[WebGL]]-enabled web browsers.{{Citation|last=3D Repo|title=Wood Wharf Development in 3D Repo|date=2016-11-24|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kAnJqdSHv2Y&feature=youtu.be|accessdate=2017-10-31}} The inner workings of the platform utilizing the X3DOM renderer developed in collaboration with [[Fraunhofer Institute]] were presented at the 20th anniversary Web3D conference in [[Heraklion]], [[Greece]].{{Cite journal|last=Scully|first=Timothy|last2=Doboš|first2=Jozef|last3=Sturm|first3=Timo|last4=Jung|first4=Yvonne|date=2015|title=3Drepo.Io: Building the Next Generation Web3D Repository with AngularJS and X3DOM|url=http://doi.acm.org/10.1145/2775292.2775312|journal=Proceedings of the 20th International Conference on 3D Web Technology|series=Web3D '15|location=New York, NY, USA|publisher=ACM|pages=235–243|doi=10.1145/2775292.2775312|isbn=9781450336475}} The platform was subsequently expanded with experimental streaming capability using [[glTF]] data format{{Cite journal|last=Scully|first=Timothy|last2=Friston|first2=Sebastian|last3=Fan|first3=Carmen|last4=Doboš|first4=Jozef|last5=Steed|first5=Anthony|date=2016|title=glTF Streaming from 3D Repo to X3DOM|url=http://doi.acm.org/10.1145/2945292.2945297|journal=Proceedings of the 21st International Conference on Web3D Technology|series=Web3D '16|location=New York, NY, USA|publisher=ACM|pages=7–15|doi=10.1145/2945292.2945297|isbn=9781450344289}} developed in collaboration with [[University College London]]. Further advanced cloud security provisions were developed in collaboration with [[British Telecom]]{{Cite news|url=http://3drepo.org/projects/3d-repo-in-a-secure-cloud-environment-a-case-study/|title=3D Repo in a Secure Cloud Environment; a Case Study|work=3D Repo - Collaborative online BIM platform|access-date=2017-10-31|language=en-US}} In 2017, 3D Repo unveiled version 2.0 based on the [[Unity (game engine)|Unity]] game engine.{{Cite news|url=https://csengineermag.com/3d-repo-releases-version-2-0-cross-platform-bim-geospatial-collaboration-software/|title=3D Repo releases version 2.0 of cross-platform BIM and geospatial collaboration software - Civil + Structural Engineer magazine|date=2017-10-26|work=Civil + Structural Engineer magazine|access-date=2017-10-31|language=en-US}} This technological interconnection received the Best Paper Award{{Cite news|url=http://3drepo.org/best-paper-award-at-web3d-2017/|title=Best Paper Award at Web3D 2017|work=3D Repo - Collaborative online BIM platform|access-date=2017-10-31|language=en-US}} at Web3D 2017 in [[Brisbane]], [[Australia]].{{Cite journal|last=Friston|first=Sebastian|last2=Fan|first2=Carmen|last3=Doboš|first3=Jozef|last4=Scully|first4=Timothy|last5=Steed|first5=Anthony|date=2017|title=3DRepo4Unity: Dynamic Loading of Version Controlled 3D Assets into the Unity Game Engine|url=http://doi.acm.org/10.1145/3055624.3075941|journal=Proceedings of the 22Nd International Conference on 3D Web Technology|series=Web3D '17|location=New York, NY, USA|publisher=ACM|pages=15:1–15:9|doi=10.1145/3055624.3075941|isbn=9781450349550}} == References == {{reflist}} [[Category:Software]] [[Category:Software by company]]

revision.comment: removed [[Category:Playstation Network games]]; added [[Category:PlayStation Network games]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
revision.text:
{{refimprove|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox video game | title = Ape Escape 3 | image = Ape Escape 3 Coverart.png | developer = [[SCE Japan Studio]] | publisher = [[Sony Computer Entertainment]] | director = Naoto Ohta
Yuzo Sugano | producer = Naoto Ohta | designer = | programmer = | artist = | writer = | composer = [[Soichi Terada]] | series = ''[[Ape Escape]]'' | platforms =[[PlayStation 2]] [[Playstation Network]] | released = {{vgrelease|JP|July 14, 2005|NA|January 17, 2006|EU|May 5, 2006}} [[Playstation Network]] {{JP|November 19, 2014}} | genre = [[Platform game|Platform]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] }} {{Nihongo|'''''Ape Escape 3'''''|サルゲッチュ3|Saru Getchu 3}} is a [[platform game|platform]] [[video game]] published and developed by [[Sony Computer Entertainment]] for the [[PlayStation 2]] [[video game console]]. ==Plot== {{See also|List of Ape Escape characters}} Specter, the Pipo Monkeys' leader, finds a Monkey Helmet, and hires the human scientist {{Nihongo|Dr. Tomoki|Dr. トモウキ|Dokutā Tomouki}} to aid him in his evil plans. They establish television stations protected by the Freaky Monkey Five where they plan to broadcast TV shows worldwide. The [[television]] shows that are broadcast on every television put every human except the twins, Kei and Yumi (Satoru and Sayaka outside of North America), their aunt Aki, and Natalie (Natsumi outside of North America) into a mindless trance. When Natsumi informs Kei and Yumi that Spike (Kakeru), Jimmy (Hikaru) and the Professor were all infected by the television show, Kei and Yumi go out to catch the monkeys and thwart Specter and Tomoki. Their mission was to go to every movie set and capture all the monkeys there and destroy the satellite there. Kei and Yumi easily capture Monkey White, Monkey Blue, and Monkey Yellow. When they reach the TV Station where Monkey Pink is, Kei and Yumi's attempts to capture her fail and she escapes. They manage to capture Monkey Red afterwards. When they reach Tomoki City, Tomoki challenges them to a battle in his giant Tomo-King robot. Tomoki, after being defeated by Kei and Yumi, and being humiliated by Specter, lets them take his rocket to space to defeat his former partner. Once they reach Specter's outer space base of operations: Space Station SARU-3, they capture all the monkeys and deactivate the movie sets on their way to Specter. When they reach Specter, he tells them his plan about how he will use his space station to cut the earth in half and keep half of it for the monkeys (leaving the other half, originally meant for Tomoki, to the humans). Afterwards he gets in his new Gorillac Mech and tries to activate his plan. He is defeated and the two escape from the satellite, leaving Tomoki to give his life to deactivate the Twin Heavens. He survives. After Specter is defeated, Monkey Pink releases him and the rest of the Freaky Monkey Five, leaving them to be caught again in extremely similar missions. To complete the game one hundred percent, all the four hundred and forty-two monkeys have to be caught, all the time trials have to be completed with a gold time, and all the items, CDs, Video Tapes (except 28), Car Skins, Genie Dance tracks, books, etc. have to be bought. The game holds a total of four hundred and thirty-four monkeys if the secret code monkeys are not caught. ==Gameplay== {{See also|Ape Escape#Gameplay|l1=Gameplay of the Ape Escape series}} Playing as either Satoru or Sayaka, gameplay follows that of [[Ape Escape#Gameplay|the previous games]] in which the player must catch several monkeys by using various gadgets controlled with right analogue stick. While there are fewer gadgets in this game than previous entries, a new feature in this game is the ability to morph into different forms through a device built by Aki.{{cite web | title = Ape Escape 3 :: PS2 Game Review | work = | publisher = Kidzworld | url = http://www.kidzworld.com/article/6386-ape-escape-3-playstation-2-video-game-review | accessdate = 2009-04-01| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090416144719/http://www.kidzworld.com/article/6386-ape-escape-3-playstation-2-video-game-review| archivedate= 16 April 2009 | deadurl= no}} Some monkeys may also try to steal the player's Stun Club or Time Net and use it against them, and can even force them out of the level by catching them with their own net. Playing as Sayaka has an additional benefit; owing to her pop idol status, certain monkeys will go star-struck upon sight of Sayaka, allowing for an easy capture. ===''Mesal Gear Solid''=== A minigame featured in the game is ''{{ill|Mesal Gear Solid: Snake Escape|jp|メサルギアソリッド}}'', a spoof of ''[[Metal Gear|Metal Gear Solid]]'' (the name is a pun on {{Nihongo|"metal"|メタル|metaru}} and {{Nihongo|"monkey"|猿|saru}}.) In this game, players control Pipo Snake, a monkey loaded with [[Solid Snake]]'s battle data, sent on a mission to rescue Snake and destroy a monkey-like Metal Gear. Gameplay is similar to ''Metal Gear Solid'' in which players have to use stealth and weapons to sneak around undetected and rescue prisoners. Players are equipped with a Banana Pistol for stunning enemies and Pineapple Grenades for breaking open flimsy walls. Similarly, the original PlayStation 2 editions of ''[[Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater]]'' include a ''Snake vs. Monkey'' mode in which Snake has to capture monkeys. ==References== ==External links== {{Portal|Anime and manga}} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20120402230601/http://us.playstation.com/games-and-media/games/ape-escape-3-ps2.html Website (North America)] {{Ape Escape series}} [[Category:2005 video games]] [[Category:3D platform games]] [[Category:Ape Escape games]] [[Category:PlayStation 2 games]] [[Category:PlayStation 2-only games]] [[Category:Sony Interactive Entertainment games]] [[Category:PlayStation Network games]] [[Category:Video game sequels]] [[Category:Video games developed in Japan]] [[Category:Video games featuring female antagonists]] [[Category:Video games featuring female protagonists]]

{{main|Argument}} [[Image:Mahmoud Ahmadinejad at Columbia 6 by David Shankbone.jpg|thumb|Two men argue at a political protest in [[New York City]].]] Whereas formal arguments are static, such as one might find in a textbook or research article, '''argumentative dialogue''' is dynamic. It serves as a published record of justification for an [[logical assertion|assertion]]. Arguments can also be interactive, in which the proposer and the interlocutor have a more symmetrical relationship. The [[premise]]s are discussed, as well the validity of the intermediate [[inference]]s. For example, consider the following exchange, illustrated by the [[No true Scotsman]] fallacy:
: Argument: "No Scotsman puts sugar on his porridge." : Reply: "But my friend Angus likes sugar with his porridge." : Rebuttal: "Ah yes, but no true Scotsman puts sugar on his porridge."
In this dialogue, the proposer first offers a premise, the premise is challenged by the interlocutor, and finally the proposer offers a modification of the premise. This exchange could be part of a larger discussion, for example a murder trial, in which the defendant is a Scotsman, and it had been established earlier that the murderer was eating sugared porridge when he or she committed the murder.
In argumentative dialogue, the rules of interaction may be negotiated by the parties to the dialogue, although in many cases the rules are already determined by social [[mores]]. In the most symmetrical case, argumentative dialogue can be regarded as a process of discovery more than one of justification of a conclusion. Ideally, the goal of argumentative dialogue is for participants to arrive jointly at a conclusion by mutually accepted inferences. In some cases however, the validity of the conclusion is secondary. For example; emotional outlet, scoring points with an audience, wearing down an opponent or lowering the sale price of an item may instead be the actual goals of the dialogue. Walton distinguishes several types of argumentative dialogue which illustrate these various goals: * Personal quarrel * Forensic debate * Persuasion dialogue * Bargaining dialogue * Action seeking dialogue * Educational dialogue
Van Eemeren and Grootendorst identify various stages of argumentative dialogue. These stages can be regarded as an argument protocol. In a somewhat loose interpretation, the stages are as follows:
* Confrontation: Presentation of the problem, such as a debate question or a political disagreement * Opening: Agreement on rules, such as for example, how evidence is to be presented, which sources of facts are to be used, how to handle divergent interpretations, determination of closing conditions. * [[Argumentation]]: Application of logical principles according to the agreed-upon rules * Closing: This occurs when the termination conditions are met. Among these could be for example, a time limitation or the determination of an arbiter.
Van Eemeren and Grootendorst provide a detailed list of rules that must be applied at each stage of the protocol. Moreover, in the account of argumentation given by these authors, there are specified roles of protagonist and antagonist in the protocol which are determined by the conditions which set up the need for argument.
Many cases of argument are highly unsymmetrical, although in some sense they are dialogues. A particularly important case of this is [[political argument]].
Much of the recent work on argument theory has considered argumentation as an integral part of language and perhaps the most important function of language ([[Paul Grice|Grice]], [[John Searle|Searle]], [[J. L. Austin|Austin]], [[Karl Popper|Popper]]). This tendency has moved [[argumentation theory]] away from the realm of pure formal logic.
One of the original contributors to this trend is the philosopher [[Chaim Perelman]], who together with [[Lucie Olbrechts-Tyteca]] introduced the French term ''La nouvelle rhetorique'' in 1958 to describe an approach to argument which is not reduced to application of formal rules of inference. Perelman's view of argumentation is much closer to a [[juridical]] one, in which rules for presenting evidence and rebuttals play an important role. Though this would apparently invalidate [[semantic]] concepts of truth, this approach seems useful in situations in which the possibility of reasoning within some commonly accepted model does not exist or this possibility has broken down because of ideological conflict. Retaining the notion enunciated in the introduction to this article that ''logic'' usually refers to the structure of argument, we can regard the logic of rhetoric as a set of protocols for argumentation.
[[Category:Arguments]] [[Category:Rhetoric]]

revision.comment: removed [[Category:British films]]; added [[Category:British film series]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2016}} {{Use British English|date=June 2016}} [[File:Auton Trilogy.jpg|thumb|right|VHS covers of the original UK releases]] The '''''Auton'' trilogy''' is a series of [[direct-to-video]] [[Spin-off (media)|spin-off]] productions based on the long running [[BBC]] [[science fiction]] series ''[[Doctor Who]]''. The three films in the series are ''Auton'' (1997), ''Auton 2: Sentinel'' (1998; working title, ''Auton 2: The Rapture'') and ''Auton 3'' (1999; working title, ''Auton 3: Awakening''). They were produced by the independent [[BBV]] company and are sequels to the [[Third Doctor]] stories ''[[Spearhead from Space]]'' and ''[[Terror of the Autons]]''. All three films have been reissued on DVD. All story elements relating to ''Doctor Who'' were licensed from their respective authors. ==Synopses== When a [[Nestene]] energy unit and several Autons are reactivated at a [[UNIT]] facility, a plot for world domination that predates mankind is set in motion. ==Plot== ===''Auton''=== {{Infobox film | name = Auton | director = [[Nicholas Briggs]] | writer = Nicholas Briggs | producer = Bill Baggs | starring = [[Michael Wade (British actor)|Michael Wade]]
Bryonie Pritchard
George Telfer
Verona Chard
[[Reece Shearsmith]] | music = Alistair Lock | cinematography = Andy Bell | editing = Bill Baggs | studio = [[BBV]] | released = 1997 | runtime = 57 minutes }} At a top secret [[UNIT]] facility known only as "the Warehouse", Dr Sally Arnold has been studying a [[Nestene]] energy unit with no results. As a last resort, she subjects the artifact to cosmic signals from UNIT's most powerful deep space scanning satellite. This causes a violent energy release that kills her assistant, Janice. The energy unit has disappeared. A containment team, led by a [[psychic]] UNIT operative named Lockwood, has been dispatched. Among Lockwood's abilities is the ability to access all information from any computer mainframe in the world with his mind. They soon learn that the Nestene energy unity has taken on a mobile form, and that there is an [[Auton]] copy of senior archivist Graham Winslet. The real Winslet is still alive, his mind being used by the Autons as a resource of information. The energy unit then merges with the Auton Winslet. Several dormant Autons in the Warehouse come back to life and the building becomes a battlefield. They are eventually defeated with the weapon created by the [[Third Doctor|Doctor]] and [[Liz Shaw (Doctor Who)|Liz Shaw]] in ''Spearhead from Space''. The Auton Winslet then liquefies and escapes through a ventilation shaft. ===''Auton 2: Sentinel''=== {{Infobox film | name = Auton 2: Sentinel | director = [[Nicholas Briggs]] | writer = Nicholas Briggs | producer = Bill Baggs | starring = Michael Wade
Jo Castleton
George Telfer | music = Alistair Lock | studio = [[BBV]] | released = 1998 | runtime = 57 minutes }} Two years after the Warehouse incident, a lorry transporting [[Auton]]s from the Warehouse to another [[UNIT]] facility is hijacked by its own cargo. Meanwhile, Lockwood is troubled by extremely active dreams. UNIT learns that the transfer of the Autons was authorized by Lockwood. When he later remembers signing the transportation docket, it becomes evident that the [[Nestene Consciousness]] is using Lockwood's psychic abilities to their own ends. UNIT's Internal Security Division launches an investigation on Lockwood, pairing him with another [[psychic]] operative named Natasha Alexander. While Lockwood's abilities are owed to an alien implant, Natasha claims to have been psychic since birth. The escaped Autons are traced to Sentinel Island. There the Auton Winslet has installed himself as the local vicar. He has brainwashed most of the island's inhabitants and the Autons have killed those who resisted. They are using the combined mental energy of the church's congregation to awaken a Nestene creature buried beneath. There are dormant Nestenes lying underground around the world. They were put in place before the development of the human race. Their locations have become known to humanity as holy sites and are connected by [[ley line]]s. When Lockwood and Natasha arrive at the church, they succeed in reviving the Nestene. The Nestene attempts to awaken the others. Lockwood tries to defeat it, but instead absorbs the creature into his own mind. ===''Auton 3''=== {{Infobox film | name = Auton 3 | director = Bill Baggs
Patricia Merrick | writer = [[Nicholas Briggs]]
(as "Arthur Wallis")
Paul Ebbs | starring = Michael Wade
Jo Castleton
George Telfer
Graeme Du Fresne
Bryonie Pritchard | released = {{Start date|df=yes|1999|06|01}} }} Lockwood and Natasha have returned from Sentinel Island, coming on shore in the town of Millhampton. Computers around the world are failing. They are being invaded by the [[Nestene Consciousness]] through Lockwood's implant. Meanwhile, the entire population of Millhampton has disappeared. They have been absorbed into the mind of another revived Nestene below the city. The only survivor is the real Winslet, who is still being used by the Nestenes at the local psychiatric hospital. Lockwood and Natasha are both being used by another psychic [[UNIT]] operative named Palmer to lead them to the heart of the Nestene activity. Palmer monitors their movements through a constant link with Natasha's mind. Meanwhile, Natasha is used by the Nestenes to lure Lockwood to the hospital, which the Autons are using as the centre of their operation. There the Auton Winslet is trying to free the Nestene energy from Lockwood's mind so it can infect every computer in the world and revive all the dormant Nestene creatures. Lockwood resists by convincing himself that everything he sees is a dream. When Dr Arnold arrives, his resolve is broken. He is then forced to sacrifice his own life to destroy the Nestene plan. ==Trivia and continuity== *''Auton'' was originally intended to include [[Brigadier Lethbridge-Stewart|Brigadier Alistair Lethbridge-Stewart]], but actor [[Nicholas Courtney]] had to decline due to the fact he was ill during production. The character of the Brigadier was replaced by Lockwood, who would also appear in the next two films. *In ''Auton 2: Sentinel'', it is revealed that Lockwood is actually the codename of the otherwise unnamed UNIT Operative 8954B. *The call sign Greyhound Leader, used in ''[[Doctor Who]]'' successively by Brigadier Lethbridge-Stewart, [[List_of_UNIT_personnel#Brigadier_Winifred_Bambera|Brigadier Bambera]],Brigadier Winifred Bambera is Greyhound Leader in ''[[Battlefield (Doctor Who)|Battlefield]]''. and [[List_of_UNIT_personnel#Kate_Stewart|Kate Stewart]],Kate Stewart is addressed as Greyhound Leader by the helicopter crew transporting the TARDIS in "[[Day of the Doctor]]". is used by three different characters in the trilogy: Lockwood (''Auton''), Colonel Wilson (''Auton 2: Sentinel'') and Ross Palmer (''Auton 3: Awakening''). *A spoof of these dramas, titled "The Auton Diaries", is included on the VHS and DVD releases of ''Auton 3: Awakening''. The plot involves an out of work Auton finding new employment at BBV. *BBV's ''Do You Have a Licence to Save this Planet'' includes an ''Auton 3''-style Auton. *[[Nicholas Briggs]], who directed the first two films and wrote all three, would go on to play the voices of the [[Daleks]] and [[Cybermen]] in the 2005 revival, as well as original Dalek voice actor, [[Peter Hawkins]], in ''[[An Adventure in Space and Time]]'' and government official, Rick Yates, in ''[[Torchwood: Children of Earth]]''. *In a chase scene about 13 minutes into ''Auton 3: Awakening'', the Autons have shadows longer than their own bodies, the sun being low in the sky. However, 10 seconds later they are seen with much shorter shadows, revealing that different parts of the chase were filmed at significantly different times of day. *US retailer Who North America (http://www.whona.com) contributed US$10,000 to the Auton 3 project. *When admiring the warehoused Auton-killing device near the end of the first film, Lockwood compliments its absent designer: "Not a bad bit of workmanship, Doctor John Smith." The [[Third Doctor]] built the device in his première serial, ''[[Spearhead from Space]]'', at the end of which he asked his new employer, [[Brigadier Lethbridge-Stewart]], to use the name John Smith on his UNIT credentials. ==See also== Other creator-authorised ''Doctor Who'' spin-offs include: *''[[Wartime (Doctor Who)|Wartime]]'' *''[[P.R.O.B.E.]]'' *''[[Downtime (Doctor Who)|Downtime]]'' *''[[Mindgame (Doctor Who)|Mindgame]]'' *''[[Shakedown: Return of the Sontarans]]'' *''[[Dæmos Rising]]'' *''[[Zygon: When Being You Just Isn't Enough]]'' ==Sources== *The Auton Trilogy video set *{{Doctor Who RG|id=auton1|title=Auton}} *{{Doctor Who RG|id=auton2|title=Auton 2: Sentinel}} *{{Doctor Who RG|id=auton3|title=Auton 3: Awakening}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{imdb title|id=0176465|title=Auton}} *{{imdb title|id=0176466|title=Auton 2: Sentinel}} *{{imdb title|id=0204851|title=Auton 3}} {{Doctor Who}} {{Auton stories}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Auton Trilogy}} [[Category:Film series introduced in 1997]] [[Category:1990s science fiction films]] [[Category:1990s thriller films]] [[Category:Alien invasions in films]] [[Category:British film series]] [[Category:British science fiction films]] [[Category:Direct-to-video film series]] [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:Film spin-offs]] [[Category:Film series]] [[Category:UNIT stories]] [[Category:Doctor Who articles lacking infobox image|F Auton trilogy]] [[Category:Bill & Ben Video]] [[Category:Screenplays by Nicholas Briggs]]

{{Infobox television |show_name = The Mis-Adventures of Awkward Black Girl |image = The Mis-Adventures of Awkward Black Girl (logo).png |genre = [[Comedy]] |creator = [[Issa Rae]] |creative_director = Mimi Valdés |starring = Issa Rae
[[Sujata Day]]
[[Tracy Oliver]]
Hanna
Madison T. Shockley III
Andrew Allan James
Harris
Fahad
Tristen Winger
Leah A. Williams
Lyman Johnson |country = United States |language = English |num_seasons = 2 |num_episodes = 25 |executive_producer = [[Pharrell Williams]]
Robin Frank |producer = Issa Rae & Tracy Oliver |network = [[YouTube]] |first_aired = {{Start date|2011|2|3}} |last_aired = {{End date|2013|2|28}} |website = http://www.awkwardblackgirl.com }} '''''The Mis-Adventures of Awkward Black Girl''''' (often simply referred to as '''''Awkward Black Girl''''') is an American [[comedy]] [[web series]] created by and starring [[Issa Rae]].{{cite web|title=Issa Rae|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/issa-rae|work=The Huffington Post|accessdate=5 November 2011}}{{cite news|last=Anderson|first=Stacy|title=Diverse Web series grows through social media|url=http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_product=APAB&p_theme=apab&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&s_dispstring=issa%20rae&p_field_advanced-0=&p_text_advanced-0=(%22issa%20rae%22)&xcal_numdocs=20&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&xcal_useweights=no|work=Associated Press|accessdate=5 November 2011|date=9 September 2011}} It premiered on a dedicated [[YouTube]] on February 3, 2011.{{cite web|title=The Mis-adventures of Awkward Black Girl - Episode 1|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nIVa9lxkbus|work=YouTube|accessdate=5 November 2011}} The show follows the life of J as she interacts with co-workers and love interests who place her in uncomfortable situations. The story is told through [[first-person narrative]] as J usually reveals how she feels about her circumstances through [[voice-over]] or [[dream sequence]]. The series received critical acclaim and won a [[Shorty Awards|Shorty Award]] for Best Web Series in 2012.{{Cite web|url=http://www.blackenterprise.com/technology/awkward-black-girl-creator-issa-rae-on-shorty-award-win-and-online-racism/|title=‘Awkward Black Girl’ Creator Issa Rae On Shorty Award Win And Online Racism|website=www.blackenterprise.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-05-12}} ==History== Issa Rae was inspired to create ''The Mis-Adventures of Awkward Black Girl'' in January 2009 while working at New Federal Theatre{{cite web|title=New Federal Theatre|url=http://www.newfederaltheatre.org/|work=New Federal Theatre|accessdate=5 November 2011}} in New York City.{{cite web|last=Giancana|first=Norell|title=Meet Awkward Black Girl's Issa Rae|url=http://www.bet.com/news/celebrities/2011/09/12/meet-awkward-black-girl-s-issa-rae.html|work=BET.com|accessdate=5 November 2011}} Experiencing difficulty in meeting people in an unfamiliar place, Issa Rae decided that it would be entertaining to depict uncomfortable scenarios one may experience when dealing with others.{{cite web|last=Anderson|first=Stacey|title=Diverse Web series grows through social media|url=https://news.yahoo.com/diverse-series-grows-social-media-120956086.html|work=Yahoo News|publisher=Associated Press|accessdate=5 November 2011}} Neglecting the idea for 2 years, Issa Rae's interest was renewed after reading an article by Leslie Pitterson{{cite web|url=http://thegrio.com/2010/04/19/wheres-the-black-version-of-liz-lemon/|title=Where's the black version of Liz Lemon?|last=Pitterson|first=Leslie|date=April 19, 2010|website=The Grio|publisher=|access-date=|work=|accessdate=}} pointing out the absence of black female nerd characters on screen.{{cite news|title='Awkward Black Girl' web hit|url=http://www.cnn.com/video/#/video/living/2011/10/08/whitfield-issa-rae-interview.cnn?iref=allsearch|work=CNN Newsroom|accessdate=5 November 2011}} She then called on friends to shoot the first episode. The series went [[viral video|viral]] through word of mouth, blog posts and [[social media]], which resulted in further media coverage.{{cite web|last=Andrews |first=Helena |title=Embracing the Awkward, One Webisode at a Time |url=http://www.theroot.com/views/embracing-awkward-one-webisode-time |work=[[The Root (magazine)|The Root]] |accessdate=5 November 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111103071703/http://www.theroot.com/views/embracing-awkward-one-webisode-time |archivedate=3 November 2011 |df= }} In an effort to fund the rest of the season, Issa Rae and producer Tracy Oliver{{cite web|title=Tracy Oliver |url=http://contributor.yahoo.com/user/1415785/tracy_oliver.html |work=Yahoo |accessdate=5 November 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111106082833/http://contributor.yahoo.com/user/1415785/tracy_oliver.html |archivedate=6 November 2011 |df= }} decided to raise money for the series through [[Kickstarter]].{{cite news|last=Rae|first=Issa|title=How Awkward Black Girl Raised Over $44,000 Through Kickstarter|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/issa-rae/kickstarter-awkward-black-girl_b_922966.html|work=The Huffington Post|accessdate=5 November 2011|date=10 October 2011}} On August 11, 2011 they were awarded $56,269 from 1,960 donations.{{cite web|title=Kickstarter - The Misadventures of Awkward Black Girl|url=http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1996857943/the-misadventures-of-awkward-black-girl/posts/106068?ref=email&show_token=30c3f7fc3079b13c|work=Kickstarter|accessdate=5 November 2011}} Due to the popularity of the series, Issa Rae has been interviewed by [[Fredricka Whitfield]] for [[CNN Newsroom]], [[Michel Martin]] for [[Tell Me More]], [[Associated Press]] and other media outlets.{{cite web|title='Awkward Black Girl' Garners Laughs|url=https://www.npr.org/2011/09/01/140113809/awkward-black-girl-garners-laughs|work=NPR|accessdate=5 November 2011}} Season 2 of Awkward Black Girl aired on [[Pharrell Williams]]'s [[i am OTHER]] in 2012-2013.{{cite news|last=Berkowitz|first=Joe|title=The Awkward Ascent Of The Misadventures Of Awkward Black Girl|url=http://www.fastcocreate.com/1681624/the-awkward-ascent-of-the-misadventures-of-awkward-black-girl|work=Fast Company|accessdate=25 March 2013|date=20 September 2012}} ==Characters and cast== * '''J''' is the self-described 'awkward and black' [[passive-aggressive]] main character who works at a [[call center]] for weight-loss pill company, Gutbusters. Throughout the series J has to deal with rival, co-worker Nina, and being in love with two men White J and Fred. As a means of dealing with the stresses of her love-life and work environment, J composes and performs rap lyrics sometimes with friend, CeCe. J is portrayed by Issa Rae, creator, actress, writer, and director.{{cite web|title=cast |url=http://www.awkwardblackgirl.com/cast |work=Awkward Black Girl Official Website |accessdate=5 November 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111103033657/http://www.awkwardblackgirl.com/cast |archivedate=3 November 2011 |df= }} * '''CeCe''' is the best friend/[[sidekick]] and co-worker of J who works in human resources. Typically excited, CeCe offers J fallible advice that usually leads J into trouble. CeCe is portrayed by actress and writer [[Sujata Day]]. * '''Nina''' is the primary antagonist and co-worker of J. She makes it her duty to stir up trouble for J and mock her. She is promoted by Boss Lady over J and appears to have dated J's love interest, Fred. Nina is portrayed by actress, writer, and producer [[Tracy Oliver]]. * '''Boss Lady''' is J's superior and an antagonist of J. She is apparently unaware of her racial insensitivity. Boss Lady is portrayed by actress Hanna. * '''Fred''' is J's initial [[love interest]] and co-worker. Fred is portrayed by actor Madison T. Shockley III. * '''A''' is an antagonist and nerdy co-worker of J. He is introduced in the series as her 'awkward mistake' after she slept with him at a company holiday party. A is portrayed by actor and dancer Andrew Allan James. * '''Patty''' is an antagonist of J and other Gutbusters employees. She is commonly referred to as Germy Patty because she is always sick and perpetually carrying tissues. Patty continues to appear at the Gutbusters office and company social events after being fired by Boss Lady. Patty is portrayed by actress Kiki Harris. * '''Amir''' is an antagonist of J and other Gutbusters employees. He makes racially insensitive jokes at the expense of his co-workers. Amir is portrayed by actor Fahad. * '''Darius''' is an antagonist and co-worker of J. He is commonly referred to as, 'Baby Voice Darius'. Darius speaks low enough that others find him inaudible except for long-time friend, Fred. He has an very loud laugh that is rarely heard. Darius is portrayed by actor Tristen Winger. * '''Dolores Clarence''' is a co-worker and antagonist of J and CeCe. She works in human resources and changes her name to Sister Mary after becoming a born-again Christian. Dolores is portrayed by actress Leah A. Williams * '''Jesus''' is J's superior and an antagonist of J. The former sensitivity trainer, he replaces Boss Lady as manager after she quits. He is portrayed by actor Michael Ruesga. * '''White Jay''' is a love interest of J who works as an anger management counselor. He is outwardly off-beat and appears to share the same awkward disposition as J. His introduction creates a [[love triangle]] between him, J and Fred, however she chooses him in the end. White Jay is portrayed by actor Lyman Johnson. * '''Jerry''' is an overly excited temporary worker at Gutbusters. He is portrayed by actor Ricky Woznichak. * '''D''' is J's former boyfriend. D is played by actor Mike Danger. ==Episodes== {{Series overview | color1 = #A4C639 | link1 = #Season 1 (2011–12) | episodes1 = 12 | start1 = {{Start date|2011|2|3}} | end1 = {{End date|2012|1|13}} | color2 = #69359C | link2 = #Season 2 (2012) | episodes2 = 12 | start2 = {{Start date|2012|6|4}} | end2 = {{End date|2013|2|28}} }} ===Season 1 (2011–12)=== Season one is mainly about J and the love triangle that mainly connects between her, Fred, and White Jay, also including A who she tries to ignore at times. J also goes through crappy moments at her job because of her awkward and competitive co-workers and she later makes a decision between Fred and White Jay, but ends up making her decision, choosing White Jay. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |-style="color:white" ! style="background: #A4C639;" | No.
overall ! style="background: #A4C639;" | No. in

At the end of "The Waiter" episode, it was announced that 2 episodes will premiere per month starting in December 2012.{{cite web|title="The Waiter" - ABG|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xIVhKmuKLOM|work=iamOTHER on YouTube|publisher=YouTube|accessdate=November 18, 2012}} {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%;" |-style="color:white" ! style="background: #69359C;" | No.

'''Guest Stars''': [[Timothy DeLaGhetto]] as The Waiter
'''Notes''': At the end of the episode, it was announced that the show will start to premiere two episodes per month starting in December 2012. Also, the episode was scheduled to premiere on November 8, 2012, but was rescheduled to November 15, 2012. | LineColor = 69359C }} {{Episode list | Title = The Group | DirectedBy = Shea William Vanderpoort | WrittenBy = Amy Aniobi

Smith | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2013|1|24}} | EpisodeNumber = 23 | EpisodeNumber2 = 10 | ShortSummary = After a huge fight, J seeks the help of CeCe and her new beau. | LineColor = 69359C }} {{Episode list | Title = The Apology (Part One)
The Change (Part Two) | DirectedBy = Shea William Vanderpoort | WrittenBy = Amy Aniobi
Chas Jackson
O.C. Smith | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2013|2|14}} (Part One)
{{Start date|2013|2|28}} (Part Two) | EpisodeNumber = 24–25 | EpisodeNumber2 = 11a
11b | ShortSummary = J juggles her final job interview, her failing relationship with White Jay, and there's a new twist at Gutbusters. | LineColor = 69359C }} |} ==Critical reception== In 2012, Rae was featured in the esteemed ''Forbes'' 30 Under 30 Entertainment List for her work with ''Awkward Black Girl''.{{cite web|title=30 Under 30 Entertainment: Issa Rae|url=https://www.forbes.com/pictures/mfl45edfge/issa-rae/|publisher=''Forbes''|accessdate=December 13, 2013|year=2012}} The show also won the Shorty Award for Best Web Show.{{cite web|title=About Me|url=http://www.issarae.com/about-me/|accessdate=12 December 2013}} Critics have praised ''Awkward Black Girl'' for its witty humor and unique, realistic portrayal of African-American women. ''New York Times'' critic Jon Caramica describes the show as “full of sharp, pointillist humor that’s extremely refreshing.” {{cite web|last=Caramanica|first=Jon|title=Life's Hard, Web Series Gracefully Illustrates|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/07/14/arts/television/issa-rae-and-awkward-black-girl-are-breaking-ground.html|publisher=''NY Times''|accessdate=December 13, 2013|date=July 13, 2012}} On her site beyondblackwhite.com, Christelyn Karazin blogs, “Aren't you tired of seeing black women look like idiots on television? Here's a girl—whom I suspect is a lot like the women who read this blog—quirky, funny, a little unsure of herself, rocks her hair natural and is beautifully brown skinned.” {{cite web|last=Karazin|first=Christelyn|title=Friday Funny: "Awkward Black Girl" Needs Us or We’ll Never Know If J Will Hook Up with Jay!|url=http://www.beyondblackwhite.com/friday-funny-awkward-black-girl-needs-us-or-well-never-know-if-j-will-hook-up-with-jay/|publisher=beyondblackandwhite.com|accessdate=December 13, 2013|date=August 4, 2011}} Erin Stegeman of ''The Tangled Web'' praises ''Awkward Black Girl'' for defying stereotypes of African American women and being “an uber-relatable slice of life, narrated by J’s inner-ramblings that run through any awkward person’s mind.” {{cite web|last=Stegeman|first=Erin|title=Awkward Black Girl|url=http://tangledwebwewatch.com/2013/07/21/the-tangled-web-team-reviews-the-mis-adventures-of-awkward-black-girl/#eastsiders|publisher=''The Tangled Web''|accessdate=December 13, 2013|date=July 21, 2013}} In its honest portrayal of the African-American experience and its depiction of the main character, J, as a "cultural mulatto," ''Awkward Black Girl'' belongs to the "New Black Aesthetic," a term coined by African-American novelist [[Trey Ellis]] to describe an artistic movement that aims to create fuller meanings of black identity by exploring intra-racial diversity, reexamining stereotypes, and presenting blackness authentically. ==See also== * [[Insecure (TV series)|''Insecure'' (TV series)]] ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== * {{official website|http://www.awkwardblackgirl.com/}} * {{IMDb title|2123765}} '''Streaming webisodes''' * {{YouTube|user=actingrl112|''The Mis-Adventures of Awkward Black Girl''}} * [https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL854514FC0EBDCD8E The Mis-Adventures of Awkward Black Girl Video Playlist] [[Category:2011 web series debuts]] [[Category:American web series]] [[Category:Comedy web series]] [[Category:Kickstarter-funded web series]] [[Category:YouTube series]]

revision.text:
[[File:2015-Ostsee-Baellebad.jpg|thumb|upright|Kid in a ball pit]] [[File:Ballpits530.jpg|thumb|right|A child playing in a ball pit]] A '''ball pit''' (originally called "'''ball crawl'''" and also known as a '''ball pool''' or '''ball pond''') is a padded box or pool filled with small colorful hollow plastic balls generally no larger than {{convert|3|in|cm}} in diameter. Instead of balls, other spherical objects can be used, such as balloons. It is typically employed as a recreation and exercise for children.
[[File:Bollhav.jpg|thumb|A ball pit as part of a larger play area]] Ball pits are often found at nurseries, [[carnival]]s, [[amusement park]]s, [[Family fun center|fun center]]s, [[fast-food restaurants]], and large [[video arcade]]s. [[Chuck E. Cheese's]] and (now defunct) [[Discovery Zone]] formerly had ball pits and they were frequently incorporated into larger play structures, such as [[maze]]s, [[Playground slide|slide]]s, and [[jungle gym]]s.
Ball pits may be rented for [[party|parties]], and smaller versions are sold for use in the home. While ball pits are traditionally intended for children, some are large enough to accommodate [[adult]]s.
Ball pits may be used together with a [[trampoline]], or combining the two by filling a closed trampoline with the balls.
==Urban legends== Beginning in the late 1990s, a number of [[urban legend]]s arose about children being severely injured or even killed due to ball-pit encounters with venomous [[snake]]s<ref>{{cite web|url=http://urbanlegends.about.com/library/blsnakes.htm|title=Snakes in the Ball Pit - Urban Legends|publisher=|accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> or [[hypodermic needle]]s.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://urbanlegends.about.com/library/blneedle.htm|title=Needles Hidden Under Gas Pump Handles Are an Urban Legend|publisher=|accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> Although there is no truth to these stories,<ref name="webmd">{{cite web|url=http://www.webmd.com/parenting/news/20010831/bounce-carefully-in-ball-pit#1|title=Bounce Carefully in the Ball Pit|publisher=|accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref> workers have reported finding dirty diapers, half-eaten food and syringes in ball pits.<ref name="webmd"/>
==In popular culture== In the ''[[Rugrats]]'' episode, "Piggy's Pizza Palace", the Rugrats jump on a costumed pig named Piggy as an act of revenge to get Angelica's tickets back. Thus, it caused the ball pit structure to split right open and all of the balls fall out all over the restaurant.
In season 3 episode 14, ("The Einstein Approximation") of the TV series ''[[The Big Bang Theory]]'', Sheldon seeks inspiration in a ball pit at a [[shopping mall|mall]], and then hides from Leonard, who becomes frustrated as he spends a good amount of time and effort trying to retrieve Sheldon from the ball pit, but Sheldon keeps saying "Bazinga".<ref>{{cite news|last1=VanDerWerff|first1=Todd|title=The Big Bang Theory: “The Einstein Approximation”|url=http://www.avclub.com/tvclub/the-big-bang-theory-the-einstein-approximation-37774|accessdate=August 25, 2016|date=February 2, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Potts|first1=Kimberly|title=Every Inside Joke on The Big Bang Theory, Alphabetized|url=http://www.vulture.com/2015/10/big-bang-theory-inside-jokes-alphabetized.html|accessdate=August 25, 2016|date=October 20, 2015}}</ref>
In 2014, a [[YouTube]] vlogger under the name ''[[Roman Atwood]]'' made a video of transforming the living room of his home into a massive ball pit, intended as a prank for his girlfriend who has returned from a trip. He later collaborates with another vlogger, [[Freddie Wong]], to create a comedy video involving giant ball pit and "ball monster" prank.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Waxman|first1=Olivia B.|title=Watch a Guy Surprise His Girlfriend by Turning Their House into a Giant Ball Pit|url=http://time.com/3674421/house-ball-pit-prank/|accessdate=August 25, 2016|work=TIME.com|date=January 20, 2016}}</ref>
In 2016, a pop-up "ball pit bar" opened in San Francisco.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2016/03/san-francisco-ball-pit-bar-is-latest-in-line-of-th.html|title=San Francisco "Ball Pit Bar" Is the Latest Crazy Themed Bar|publisher=|accessdate=4 October 2016}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Closed inflatable trampoline]] *[[Dashcon]], for the "extra hour with the ball pit" [[meme]]
==References== {{Commons category|Ball pits}} {{reflist}}

{{Use mdy dates|date=May 2012}}
{{Infobox named horse |horsename=Bamboo Harvester |image= File:Mister Ed.JPG |imagesize= |alt= |caption= Bamboo Harvester as Mister Ed | birth_name = Bamboo Harvester | othername = [[Mister Ed]] |breed= [[American Saddlebred]]/[[part-Arabian]] |discipline= Movie horse |sire= |grandsire= |dam= |damsire= |sex= [[Gelding]] |foaled= 1949 |death_date= {{death year and age|1970|1949}} |country= USA |color= [[Palomino]] |breeder= |owner= |trainer= |racerecord= |raceearnings= |racewins= |raceawards= |otherawards= |honors= |updated= }}
'''Bamboo Harvester''' (1949–1970) was the name of the [[American Saddlebred]]/[[part-Arabian]] horse that portrayed [[Mister Ed]] on the 1961–1966 comedy series of the same name. Foaled in 1949, the [[gelding]] was trained by [[Will Rogers]]' protégé, Les Hilton. He was born in the [[Los Angeles]] area but sources disagree as to whether his birthplace was in [[El Monte, California|El Monte]]<ref name="BeckClark2002">{{cite book|author1=Ken Beck|author2=Jim Clark|title=The Encyclopedia of TV Pets: A Complete History of Television's Greatest Animal Stars|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=VKS1-aBvXawC&pg=PT267|year=2002|publisher=Thomas Nelson Inc|isbn=978-1-4185-5737-9|page=267ff}}</ref> or at Harvester Farms in [[Chatsworth, Los Angeles|Chatsworth, California]].<ref>[http://www.chatsworthhistory.com/Documents/PastPresent/Harvester%20Farms%20-%20CHS.pdf "Harvester Farms"] in ''Chatsworth Past & Present'', February 2015.</ref><ref>[http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1997-02-02/entertainment/9701300966_1_harvester-poultry-farm-stud-farm "Mr. Ed's Home May Become A Landmark"], ''[[Los Angeles Daily News]]'' as reprinted in ''[[Orlando Sentinel]]'', February 2, 1997.</ref>
In 1968, two years after the cancellation of ''Mister Ed'', at the age of 19, Bamboo began to suffer from a variety of age related ailments, including [[kidney]] problems and [[arthritis]]. He was [[animal euthanasia|euthanized]] in 1970.
A second palomino horse, which had posed for still pictures used in [[press kit]]s for the show, survived until 1979. After Bamboo Harvester's death in 1970, the second horse was unofficially known as ''Mister Ed''.
== Pedigree ==
{{Pedigree | name = Bamboo Harvester "[[Mister Ed]]" | f = The Harvester [[American Saddlebred]] (Born 1938) | m = Zetna Hara [[Arabian horse|Part-Arab]] (Born 1945) | ff = Revel's Cream of Wheat (Born 1932) | fm = Red Dawn | mf = Antez ([[Arabian horse|Arabian]]) (Born 1921) | mm = Koricha (breed unknown) (Born 1935) | fff = Rey El Moreno(Born 1924) | ffm = Highland Squirrel King's Lady(Born 1921) | fmf = Exclamation Rex Squirrel(Born 1922) | fmm = Unknown Mare | mff = Harara(Born 1912) | mfm = Moliah(Born 1911) | mmf = Unknown | mmm = Unknown | ffff = Solano(Born 1916) | fffm = Lois Hardy(Born 1917) | ffmf = Highland Squirrel King(Born 1899) | ffmm = Queen(Born 1900) | fmff = Forrest Rex(Born 1909) | fmfm = Emily Easton(Born 1917) | fmmf = Unknown | fmmm = Unknown | mfff = Deyr(Born 1904) | mffm = Haffia(Born January 1906) | mfmf = Hamrah(Born 1904) | mfmm = Wadduda(Born 1899) | mmff = Unknown | mmfm = Unknown | mmmf = Unknown | mmmm = Unknown }}
== Death ==
By 1968, Bamboo Harvester was suffering from a variety of health problems. Controversy surrounds the story of his demise, and there are at least two separate versions of what happened, both from plausible sources which might reasonably be expected to have the correct story. In one version, he was euthanized in 1970 with no publicity, and buried at Snodgrass Farm in [[Oklahoma]].<ref> {{cite web | url = https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/1551 | title = Mister "MistEd" Ed (1949–1970) – Find A Grave Memorial | last = Leon | first = Ronald | publisher = [[Find a Grave]] | accessdate =February 8, 2010 }}</ref> However, a different version was given by [[Alan Young]]. Young wrote that he had frequently visited his former co-star in retirement. He states that Mr. Ed died from an inadvertent tranquilizer administered while he was "in retirement" in a stable in [[Burbank, California]], where he lived with his trainer, Lester Hilton. Young says Hilton was out of town visiting relatives and a temporary caregiver might have seen Ed rolling on the ground, struggling to get up. Young said Ed was a heavy horse and he was not always strong enough to get back on his feet without struggling. The theory is that the caregiver thought the horse was in distress and administered a tranquilizer and for unknown reasons the horse died within hours. The remains were cremated and scattered by Hilton in the Los Angeles area at a spot known only to him.<ref name="Young1">Young, Alan. ''Mr. Ed and Me'' 1994, St. Martins Press, New York, {{ISBN|0-312-11852-X}}, pp. 181-3.</ref>
In this version it was a different horse that died in Oklahoma in February 1979 which widely thought to be Bamboo Harvester, but instead this horse was mere one that posed for the still pictures of "Mr. Ed" used by the production company for the show's press kits. After Bamboo Harvester's death in 1970, this horse was unofficially known as Mister Ed, which led to him being reported as such (including sardonic comments on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'s'' [[Weekend Update]]) following his own death.<ref name="OnlyInOK"> {{Cite web | url = http://www.tulsaworld.com/news/article.aspx?subjectid=260&articleid=071005_1_A4_Thefa71154&archive=yes | title = Only in Oklahoma: The famous Mister Ed still keeps 'em talking | first = Gene | last = Curtis | publisher = [[Tulsa World]] | work = tulsaworld.com |date=October 7, 2007 | accessdate =February 8, 2010 }}</ref>
Young said when the Oklahoma horse death story came out in 1979, he knew it was not the real Mr. Ed, but did not have the heart to "shatter their illusions" that the horse being memorialized was not the real Mr. Ed. He believes it was a horse used for early publicity photos.<ref name="Young1"/>
The real Bamboo Harvester was laid to rest in 1970, on the farm at Snodgrass Farm in [[Tahlequah, Oklahoma]], with no marker. It wasn't until summer 1990, 'Mr. Ed' fans of Oklahoma dedicated a standing granite gravestone to honor the grounds of his grave, though the epitaph uses his stage name and image as 'Mr. Ed', and does not mention his death date of 1970.
== References == {{reflist}}

'''Bengali rock''' ([[Bengali language|Bengali]]: বাংলা রক) is a music genre in which the song lyrics are written in the [[Bengali language]]. It may refer to:
* [[Rock music of West Bengal]] * [[Bangladeshi rock|Rock music of Bangladesh]]
